title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 05 June 2013 - XWiki
content:
<xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
16:46 <gdelhumeau\_> we have $xwiki.user in 5.1m1, but not in SRD  
16:48 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
16:48 <bouquetf> has joined #xwiki  
16:49 <kstuart> has quit  
16:57 <kstuart> has joined #xwiki  
17:01 <msmeria1> has quit  
17:01 <gdelhumeau\_> sdumitriu: do we have the same problem with Groups?  
17:02 <sdumitriu> Yes  
17:02 <sdumitriu> Well, not as much  
17:02 <sdumitriu> Since it doesn't make sense to have groups from Facebook  
17:02 <sdumitriu> But it does make sense to have LDAP groups  
17:03 <sdumitriu> But wiki groups should be able to hold remote users  
17:03 <sdumitriu> So in my XWiki.AdminsGroups I should be able to put users from different sources  
17:05 <gdelhumeau\_> I'm looking at http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7530 , as I had a similar issue for a client  
17:05 <gdelhumeau\_> The  members or a group are listed with an HQL query  
17:06 <gdelhumeau\_> But, since a member can be an other group (from whatever wiki), I need to make recursive queries to get all the final users  
17:06 <gdelhumeau\_> Sounds good?  
17:07 <gdelhumeau\_> Because at the end, I care about users, not subgroups. (eg: Is my User inside this group ?)  
17:08 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
17:10 <sdumitriu> Right  
17:10 <sdumitriu> Makes sense  
17:27 <sburjan> has quit  
17:28 <msmeria> has quit  
17:33 <gdelhumeau\_> sdumitriu: if I want to fix XWikiUser.isUserInGroup(), where should I put my recursive queries ? In isUserInGroup() ? Or in groupService.getAllGroupsReferencesForMember() ?  
17:33 <sdumitriu> isUserInGroup  
17:34 <sdumitriu> That seems to require less queries  
17:34 <sdumitriu> But then we also need to be able to respond correctly to getAllGroupsReferencesForMember  
17:34 <sdumitriu> So maybe both  
17:58 <Slashman> has quit

18:18 <vmassol> guys we have lots of build failures  
18:18 <vmassol> enterprise is failing because of duplicate classes  
18:18 <vmassol> [WARNING] Found duplicate classes in [org.restlet.jee:org.restlet:2.1.1,org.restlet.jse:org.restlet:2.0.14] :  
18:18 <vmassol> see http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise/10224/consoleText  
18:18 <vmassol> any idea?  
18:18 <vmassol> I couldn't find any pom change  
18:21 <tmortagne> vmassol: maybe solr upgrade (don't know if it's using restlet)  
18:21 <sburjan`> has quit  
18:21 <tdelafosse> has joined #xwiki  
18:21 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
18:22 <sdumitriu> tmortagne: I didn't get the step at all  
18:22 <sdumitriu> But I don't have any custom extensions installed, except the base package  
18:22 <vmassol> has quit  
18:23 <tmortagne> I'm talking about the step where you choose if you want to have DW on each wiki or only the main one  
18:23 <tmortagne> that's the step canceled in your status  
18:24 <sdumitriu> Oh, I didn't get that one  
18:24 <sdumitriu> Actually I had to run the DW on each wiki  
18:27 <tmortagne> not sure how you can end up with that step cancel without getting it at all, maybe a bug if you canceled it in the previous install  
18:27 <tmortagne> I upgraded from 5.0.2 to 5.0.3 on a wiki yesterday and I got it  
18:37 <gdelhumeau\_> first proposal  
18:41 <sburjan`> has quit  
18:51 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
18:54 <qwebirc21837> has joined #xwiki  
18:54 <qwebirc21837> hello  
18:55 <qwebirc21837> i need some help  
18:55 <qwebirc21837> im trying to install xwiki project into a weblogic server  
18:55 <qwebirc21837> but i cant  
18:55 <qwebirc21837> i get the error org.hibernate.HibernateException: Errors in named queries: listGroupsForUser, getWikiMacroDocuments  
18:56 <qwebirc21837> im using weblogic 10  
18:56 <qwebirc21837> and xwiki-enterprise-web-5.0.1.war  
18:56 <qwebirc21837> somebody can help me?  
18:57 <sburjan`> has quit
